result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-4TH Offense [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration-4TH Offense [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-4TH Offense [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration-4TH Offense [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Stacey Lavelle Glenn was found guilty of Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-4TH Offense [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to case 22CF1226 and any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Complete a course in anger management.
Complete a psych evaluation and any treatment that is recommended.

supervisions.notes:
AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Court Order For Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Provide DNA sample.
Pay a fine of $2,400.00.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges, DNA be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court waives all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacey Lavelle Glenn

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Sentencing Hearing (45 pages) commencing 10-06-2022, by Debra A. Wisniewski.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stacey Lavelle Glenn in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Stacey Lavelle Glenn.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing hearing held. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statement made by Deborah B.

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, consecutive to CASE 22CF1226 and any other sentence, with credit for 58 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Complete a psych evaluation, and any treatment that is recommended.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Driver's license revocation for 2 years.
- IID installation for 2 years.
- Pay a fine of $2,400.00.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges (DNA) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Stacey Lavelle Glenn in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Stacey Lavelle Glenn.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1 : Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

As to Count 2 : Court orders charge dismissed by operation of law.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered the defendant remanded into custody pending sentencing. Case adjourned, Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Jury Instructions
signed, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Stacey Lavelle Glenn appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court in person for Stacey Lavelle Glenn.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk
Court ordered absolute sobriety and NO driving without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Stacey Lavelle Glenn in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Stacey Lavelle Glenn in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an initial appearance.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court set cash bail.  Case adjourned for a preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
